products.title: Canon PowerShot A2200
products.description:
Canon PowerShot A2200 is a compact point-and-shoot digital camera built to be light and small enough to put in a pocket. This is a step up from the Canon PowerShot A1200, with a 14.1 megapixel sensor and a rechargeable lithium-ion battery. The next camera in the series, the Canon PowerShot A3300, is slightly scaled up with just a better optical zoom and a larger sensor and LCD display. Otherwise the system is the same as the Canon PowerShot A1200, with a 4x wide-angle optical zoom and the ability to record video in 720p high definition. A number of creative filters are available, including "toy camera" and monochrome. Discrete mode is also available, enabling the use of the camera without any noise or flash.

Features

  • 14.1 megapixels
  • 4x wide-angle optical zoom
  • Creative filters
  • 720p HD video
  • Discrete mode
  • 2.7-inch LCD
  • Lithium-ion battery

pros.text: has a solid feel and weight, feels like a serious bit of equipment
pictures are excellent, sharp and bright, on par with most handhelds
uses AA batteries, easy to grab replacements on the go
macro mode works very well, can get very close to the subject if you want
screen is large and bright, easy to see what you're photographing
Auto settings are right almost all the time, never have to play with it
image stabilization is excellent even at extreme zoom

cons.text: flash takes a long time to recharge
